message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
synchronized(map) {
    Iterator<Map.Entry<String, String>> it = map.entrySet().iterator();
    while(it.hasNext()) {
        Map.Entry<String, String> entry = it.next();
        // do something with entry
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The ConcurrentModificationException is thrown when you try to modify a collection while iterating over it using an Iterator, in a way that is not allowed. This usually happens when you are iterating over a collection and at the same time trying to modify it by adding or removing elements. To avoid this, you can synchronize your code block to make sure that your HashMap is not being accessed by another thread while you are iterating over it.
